intro: Gleichenia linearis, commonly known as the slender maidenhair fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Gleicheniaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, linear fronds that are typically 30–100 cm in length. The plant has a creeping rhizome and produces sporangia on the underside of its fronds, which are clustered in strobila. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Gleichenia linearis is often found in woodland areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
